title: Riot OCE Update and Q&A
body:
**TL:DR We want to update you on what we have worked so far and what we are working on. This update may not cover everything so if you feel we should cover a specific topic, let us know.**

Summoners,

we are halfway through the year and seems like a good time to stop for a second and reflect on what have we done in the first half of 2015 and what more we need to do to make sure we live up to your expectations. 
When discussing internally about things we could improve, among the several areas of work there was one which we believe is the key to succeed in our mission: better communication with our OCE players.
We provided updates in the past but we want to try something now and introduce the “_**tell us what you want to be updated on**_”

Below you will find updates from some of the Rioters in the Sydney office. These are information we think may interest you but hey, we may be wrong.
If there is something you feel we should give an update on (e.i. WTF is the OCE skin just to name one), please post it below. 
The upvote / downvote system will do the rest and if a topic is popular enough, we might create a sticky post like Stupendous did for [Ocean Week Reef](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/fr6JJdBE-ocean-week-reef-status). 
The idea behind _stickying _the most popular questions is that at any given point you should find updated information on the sticky so if you, a friend or a random OCE player asks “Hey Rito, what’s going on with the Ocean Week statue” we can always point him/her to that post.

To set some expectations: there are some topics we, from the Sydney office, are better equipped to answer (like local events, community, esport, connectivity…) and some other we are not (champion design, game balance, game features). We will do our best to reply to both but we may need the help from other Rioters in Santa Monica and this may take more time.

Here the topics you will find in this update:
- [Talent](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/iFdEkXnp-riot-oce-update-and-qa?comment=0004)
- [Service Availability](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/iFdEkXnp-riot-oce-update-and-qa?comment=0000)
- [Community](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/iFdEkXnp-riot-oce-update-and-qa?comment=0001)
- [Events](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/iFdEkXnp-riot-oce-update-and-qa?comment=0005)
- [Competitive](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/iFdEkXnp-riot-oce-update-and-qa?comment=0003)
- [Player Behavior](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/iFdEkXnp-riot-oce-update-and-qa?comment=0002) 

Thanks for your attention and looking forward to some tough questions :)
MasterMirkinen

I know your riot OCE guys probably hate getting this, but it's been over 2 years since the OCE server was released, and we still don't have our server skin.
The community has thrown numerous ideas at you, some good, most bad. Obviously because of the wide diversity of the OCE server, it's hard to make a skin that will appeal to everyone, and we understand that.
But at this point, most of us honestly couldn't care what the skins theme is, and the ones that do are probably in the vast minority. Most people have given up on ever getting the skin, but I'm still hopeful that it will come eventually. There was an update a few months ago I think, but I'm not too sure.
We just want to know what's happening with it, if you've narrowed it down to a few ideas or what, anything, and if you can give us an ETA on it.

Next question, what ever happened to Riot Penguinguru? he was active on forums for a bit then seemed to disappear off the face of the earth.

Also, are there any plans to continue or restart with the Riot vs OCE Community games? Those were really fun, and I'm sure everyone that watched or played enjoyed it a lot, as it was a way for the OCE Rioters to get to interact with the community and for the community to get to know the rioters better. Obviously some improvements could be made, as some people got to play in multiple games, like myself, which was a bit unfair.

Sorry for the long post, and thanks for making this thread, interacting with the playerbase and helping us understand what you're doing and planning to do is always good.

Putting down that if the demand is there and we can fit it in with all casting we're doing, I personally would love to jump in and cast some of these games. Community vs. Riot is always so hype!

Could RP prizes be a possibility? I'm sure a lot more players would get involved then!
On top of this, possibly more news posts in-client about upcoming planned broadcast times before they happen. Last time other than seeing it in-client while it was already live, I didn't see anything stating there was an upcoming community broadcast.

We could throw prizes at things but I feel like that misses the point. For us, it was about having fun with the community, and we hoped that was fun enough as is. I have seen a few posts on this tonight, and I honestly didn't realize that some of you still remembered us doing this a year ago. If we continue to see players asking for this, I'd love to make this happen again.

Hey GoldenTomato, great to see you here and thanks for the questions.
I'll reply to the first 2 questions and Riot Cochese will talk a little about the community games.
> I know your riot OCE guys probably hate getting this, but it's been over 2 years since the OCE server was released, and we still don't have our server skin.... 
...We just want to know what's happening with it, if you've narrowed it down to a few ideas or what, anything, and if you can give us an ETA on it.

We are not hating getting this **at all,** we created this post with the OCE skin in mind actually (you may notice we even called it out in the original post) because we feel this is a big pain point we are not delivering.
Last year we submitted to the skin team some ideas but ultimately they were not successful for several reason (no global appeal, not suitable for a champion...). This February we submitted another idea (which came from Maraudaur) and the skin team loved it! They loved it to the point they started evaluating it as a skin relevant for the lore or LOL and not just OCE. By doing this, the process slowed down more. There was also a flag on a particular aspect of the skin which required a bit of investigation. In the last couple of weeks we had good conversations with the skin team and we are now ready to move to the next steps which are:
- skin team to work on a prototype
- OCE team to work on launch plan (to make this special for OCE players)
- once prototype is ready, there will be a go - no go meeting as every skin has to reach a level of quality and we cannot confirm 100% till we see it created.
- release the skin
In term of ETA, this is not possible to say. If everything goes well, it could be at the end of they year but if something goes wrong it could be later. We may reach a point though were pushing more is not going to lead to anything and if we reach that point, we may not have an OCE skin. We are not close to that point yet but if we do, we will tell you straight away.

> Next question, what ever happened to Riot Penguinguru? he was active on forums for a bit then seemed to disappear off the face of the earth.

He left Riot.

Hello everyone,
 
I’m Riot Cochese and I run the Live Services team here in Oceania.

My first thought, as I sat down to write this update was: what can I write here that won’t upset our players that have connectivity issues, those that seem to suffer more pains than other players, the ones that feel we aren’t doing anything to help them. 

We have come a long way since that first day, and if you take away any message here, please know we are not sitting idle. We are not done; we are continuously looking for improvements and working with ISPs to get the absolute best for all of you.
 
Looking back to launch, there have been a number of improvements over the years. We went from, very excited to get the region launched, to the unknown, and then a slew of challenges and player pains to address. We’ve learned so much about the region since then. For one, this part of the world is massive in size and scale, how do you facilitate a great experience for every player, in every location?
 
There have been some bumps and bruises; in fact, most of you would likely associate my name to an incident that occurred at one time or another – because that’s where I post on the boards – in "Help and Support". The truth is, when our team is doing a good job, you won’t even notice, because you are able to play the game, when and where you want. That’s the way it should be! We love going unnoticed, trust me, but that is not always the case.
 
**What have we done?**
 
*  Added more diversity to our datacenter, to get better coverage across all the major ISPs in the region
* Established syncs with ISP providers to discuss pain points we see, and hear from you
* Improved the patching process, I hope nobody remembers the 8 hour patches that occurred last year! The last patch, 5.14, was 45mins total.
* There is more, but I’m not here to pat our teams back
 
**Our commitment to you?**
 
* Push ISPs to improve in areas that we see our players having problems in
* Be clear and forthcoming about service issues that impact you
* Listen to what is important to you, and focus on improving those areas: Connection Quality!
* Take decisive action to make things better, working from your feedback, and enacting positive change

I’m not here to say that our service is perfect, but committing to making it better every single day.
 
GL;HF
Riot Cochese

Hi,

Will ranked 3s ever come to OCE? What about normal 3s permanently? Any information about 3s on OCE would be nice :)

Hi Guys

I am putting these words together as we run towards our first dedicated esports and community event in OCE. We are so excited to share it with you, our players, both at Luna Park, Sydney and online via the OPL Grand Final live broadcast [website](http://oce.lolesports.com/). 

I know there are a lot of questions around why are we not going to other OCE shows, but we truly believe that by creating our own dedicated events we are able to deliver to our players a more unique and deeper experience. 

Once the OPL Final is complete we will be able to learn from the players that attended, what worked, what didn’t and what they want to see more off. This will help us shape our events vision for 2016.

If you have any questions on the Luna Park OPL Grand Final or around events in general please let us know in the comments below and we will do our best to answer.

What an exciting year for esports! So far 2015 has seen the creation of the Oceanic Pro League, Oceanic Challenger Series and the Oceanic Open Ladder. 16 universities battled it out to claim Oceanic Uni bragging rights. The regions dedicated [esports website!](http://oce.lolesports.com/) launched. We all watched The Chiefs represent Oceania against the world in Turkey and of course I think we’re all excited for the OPL final at [Luna Park](http://promo.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/oplfinals-2015/).

So what are we working on right now? Obviously the OPL Grand Final event is going to be a big one. I won’t steal General Coxy’s thunder, though, so read more about the event below! 

Spring semester is almost in class so any Uni students can look forward to another [university tournament!](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/esports/esports-event/rally-your-classmates-next-uni-tournament)! Anyone at university can get involved and the final will be streamed live from the Sydney studio. Group stages start soon so check it out asap.

We’ve also got the Worlds Wildcard Qualifier coming up in August. The winner of the OPL Grand Final will travel to Istanbul, Turkey to compete against Japan, SEA and Turkey for a ticket to the big show in Europe. We’ll be broadcasting all the action so you won’t miss a minute. 

So where do we go from here? We’ve got a strategic plan, but we also want to hear from the fans. What do you want from esports that you’re not currently getting? What do you admire about the LCS that you would like to see Oceania adopt? Maybe there’s something cool the NRL, AFL or A-League does you think would be awesome for esports. Please let us know!

Hey everyone,

Conquisitor here to give you all an update on hiring!

When the first work on the server started out it was just MasterMirkinen and Loote. Since then we've been aiming to find the best talent to help us deliver the best gaming experience and service we can.

We now have a number of Rioters working across Live Services, Publishing, Esports and Talent who are focused on improving the player experience here.

Some of the more recent hires include a content editor and video editor for the creative services team and a recruiter. These Rioters have only just started in the last couple of weeks so you might see them popping up on the boards soon.

We're also looking for more Rioters to join the team. The roles we have open here are:

* Head of People
* Broadcast Manager
* Esports - League Operations
* Director of Technology
* Analyst
* Visual Designer
* Player Behaviour Specialist

You can read more about them [here](http://www.riotgames.com/careers/?offices=1427&depts=) 

If you have any questions about working at Riot or the recruitment process let me know in the comments below!

Hey Conquisitor!

I'm super interested in the esports side of things and in particular the Broadcasting of it. I run the esports club at my university in New Zealand and as such I've put on a few tournaments myself and run the broadcasting side of things too. I've been a part of other projects such as last semester's Oceanic Collegiate Championship running the broadcast team for that.

I'd love to talk to some of the people involved and hear about what they do for Riot on both the Esports Team and the Broadcast Team. I'm always looking to improve my work and I imagine the people in those teams are some of the best.

Secondly, what would it take to stand out to Riot? Do you simply go for the most experienced and qualified applications or are there certain qualities you might spot in someone that would make their application shine just a little brighter?
Hey mate, I handle our Broadcast and am also a part of the eSports team. Happy to answer any questions you have!

Hey Smite

Thanks for the message. Its great to hear how passionate you are about the broadcast of eSports. We'll get a Rioter from the eSports team to  respond to directly. 

As for what would 'stand out' in an application. 

1)  Passion for video games and the local LoL community.  Is this person a gamer? Do they have a genuine passion to help level up the player experience in Oceania? This are questions we ask when looking at an application. 

2)  The key here is how qualified is the applicant in relation to an open position. We typically look for Rioters who have an area of expertise which will add instant value to the office. For example, with our  Data Analyst position we're looking for a passionate video gamer who also have a background in statistics, data and business consulting experience. 

Cheers!

Hey, any tips for video making? I've been making a few highlight videos for some OPL games recently and any sort of advice would be amazing and very much appreciated. (Can be found at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCAQqsqmbGiA7o3Oa1cN2QPw if you're interested in having a look)

Hey there,

Sorry for the late reply on this one – it’s been pretty crazy with the OPL final. It’s really cool that you’re working on highlights – they can be tough work!

In terms of advice I’d say that you should try and focus on getting the technical elements right. No matter how well edited, if your sound isn’t right then people will be turned off. ( I know you had a glitch with your recorder so you’re already on the right track). Another thing is to make your transitions a little smoother and a little more obvious – sometimes you bring in the next shot before the previous one has finished its transition out - if using a dip to black between plays, make sure your video and audio fade out completely before you fade in the next shot. 

Other than that I would say just keep practicing and getting better. If you have any more specific questions or you think I’m wrong (it’s definitely possible…) let me know!

Hey Conquisitor,
I have a question about the analyst position, would you consider a physics degree an appropriate qualification for the position? From looking at the skills required, I believe I have those, but I'm not sure about the formal qualification.
Thanks

Hey  there,

I work in Recruitment as well, so I hope that I can help answer your question.

For the Analyst role, I don't believe that a Physics degree is the most appropriate qualification for the position, as the role is mostly business oriented, with a large focus on data, numbers and statistics. That said, a physics degree could be fine if you have working experience as an Analyst.

Let me know if any of that was unclear, and I'll be happy to elaborate further.

Best,

Hey Summoners,

Maraudaur here to give you an update about **Community** and what we have been working on.

We have been working on more ways to support the community. Our newest feature is the [Community Events Portal!](http://events.oce.leagueoflegends.com/) this is your one stop shop for events run by the community for the community. For players looking to participate this is the place to look for events happening online or live in your area. For players that are looking to organise events this is the place to go to register your event. Not only will this get your event up on our page, but approved tournaments will also receive prizing from us (Just make sure to read the FAQs). We have a tonne of Boarding Parties happening (Bilgewater themed community events) so make sure to check it out.

We’ve also been working closely with community groups and university clubs to help them deliver better experiences and prizes to their members, if you run regular events or have ideas on what we can do to help you help your community please get in touch! You can find me on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RiotMaraudaur) and [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100006763489424).

The boards have also been around for a while now and it's picking up pretty well. We’ve had a few Q&A’s from international Rioters ranging from people who shoutcast to people who create champions you can check some of them out [here](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/zEhMeJ1b-im-david-phreak-turley-ask-me-stuff) and [here](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/bRM5LnY0-meddler-lead-champion-designer-qa). There are also numerous Q&A’s from pro players in the OPL which you can find in the [Esports subboard](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/esports). The boards is a great place to come to talk to players and Rioters alike so log on and join the discussions or even jump on and share your feedback about what we could do to make it even better. 

On our social media we have had a few channels for fan artists and cosplayers to display their talents but recognise that we've also got great video creators in the OCE community, so we've created a portal where they can submit their video creations to us [here](http://woobox.com/3udwwu).We will check out all submissions and it's an opportunity for them to possibly featured on the League of Legends OCE Facebook page.

If you have any questions about any of this, or any questions in general, the team will do their best to answer them below!

Hey everyone,

The Instant Feedback system has been rolled out in July and is being monitored by Lyte's team. It's important to note that the settings start off conservative for this system and are gradually being ramped up over time.

If you want to read more into the vision for the Instant Feedback System then check out Lyte’s post: http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/new-player-reform-system-heads-testing 

There was also some confusion on the messaging that every time you press report you will receive feedback if someone is banned. It's only if your report is the final action that triggered the penalty.

What this means is that you won't receive feedback every single time. When the system was being tested it was setup so every report that contributed received an alert, but it tends to be pretty spammy so this was scaled back to just the trigger report.

Your feedback is super important for this entire process, so if you have thoughts/questions about the system please let us know in the comments.

We're also pushing forward in the search for a Player Behaviour Specialist in OCE. We have a local strike team that works closely with Lyte's team to help out in any way we can, but we want a specialist that can make our team even better at this.

You can check out the job description for the role here: http://www.riotgames.com/careers/54259

To see the breakdown of the existing player behaviour systems on the server please stop by the PB FAQ here: http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/L65wrRYe-player-behaviour-faq-updated-for-instant-feedback

If you have any questions please post them in the comments below!

Regarding your Player Behaviour Specialist, please be aware that in Australia, the 'C-Bomb' is dropped frequently, but it doesn't carry the same weight as it does in other regions. It's a cultural thing here, albeit an unfortunate one. Australians are more offended by homophobic or racist taunts. The 'C-Bomb' is how we say hello here, even to our best friends. {{champion:17}}

Hi, I am looking for someone who either specialises in or knows a lot about the matchmaking system to discuss it's functionality and potential.

I have added every rioter from this thread (sorry kind of desperate) looking for a way to get in contact with staff who have control over or knowledge about the matchmaking system whether they are based in NA or wherever. I am looking to help league as a whole grow into something more.

Hey WhitePumah,

Would love to hear your ideas around the MMR/league system! Once you've posted below I can try and find the right person to answer you

Instead of the traditional win/loss rating system which was specifically designed for one on one chess.

A role selector when actually in champion select that you get to choose when it is your turn, which means pick order will still be relevant to the picking of roles but in case of trolls you will not be restricting to only picking what is left from the roles not chosen (choose roles others have also chosen).

Once in game each role will have a performance rating specific to that role such as for adc they will be based on cs and kda, support can have warding and ability usage rating so each role can have a specific rating indication based on their champion type (tank/fighter) etc with a general performance based statistics which can determine how well they did in that game and give them mmr according to the average of the game. Meaning if you still lose the game you could go up in mmr if you performed well enough.

Will OCE ever get a tribunal? like seriously i'm sick of trolls at the moment {{champion:17}} 
Thanks a lot :D

Hi guys,

As an Australian player I played on NA with friends and didn't like ping so I switched to OCE and I love it.

However OCE lacks Draft Pick in normals because of an obvious lower player count than NA. **My question is:** wouldn't removing Blind Pick Normals or Team Builder and replace with Draft Pick Normals force everyone to that queue? Can we perhaps expect a Draft Pick Normals in Season 6?

Have a great day.
MrSnapp

I miss draft pick too. I personally prefer it to blind pick.

With all of the queues they are evaluated regularly. We're not in a place right now where we are looking at bringing normal draft back, but it is something that comes up at every evaluation meeting - as do all of the queue types.

Ultimately it's about evaluating the numbers and being confident that it would provide a good experience. If we do move towards opening it back up we'll announce it on boards etc.

Why don't you guys bring it and Dominion back as a weekly thing in the same way as Twisted Treeline?
Thursday Draft pick, Saturday Dominion? Or something?
Blind pick is pretty cancerous even at the best of times (I sure love picking Janna into Blitzcrank!), and Ranked is just full of people wanting to play the top tier champions and nothing else. I've stopped playing LoL as much since Draft was removed about a year ago, and I sure as hell wasn't having any negative experiences with Draft queue timers, even in the small hours of the morning.
What if I told you that the number of people that would rather Draft Pick normals is a lot less than Blind Pick Normals.  Removing Blind Pick for Draft Pick is a very, very bad idea.

Hey,
When is 3v3 ranked or 3v3 map itself permanently coming out?

Heya!

I am just wondering if you will ever make dominon and TT permanent game modes on OCE. Instead of focusing on 2 week game modes could you focus on more permanent modes.

Thanks,

Chrome Shadow

What equipment is involved in the broadcasting of OPL?
I'm aware a tricaster is used for switching. My question is more about what cameras, microphones, communication devices as well as anything else is used?

Just to clarify, by _communication devices_ I mean if anything is used throughout broadcasts as a means of live communication between various members in the broadcasting team.
